INTERSHOP IOM 5.0.0-SNAPSHOT Database Model   (revision 4e456913bd5bea9b32ffb837888b12ef800f8dfb)

Table oms.Supplier2DeliveryOptionDefDO

Delivery option naming as used by a supplier instead of defaults.

Columns 

References[1] Column Type Constraints[2] Default Comment
id bigint PK, UNIQUE, NOT_NULL  
DeliveryOptionDefDO deliveryOptionDefRef integer NOT_NULL The delivery option that should have a supplier-specific naming. 
supplierDeliveryOptionName varchar(50) The name of the delivery option as used by the supplier instead of defaults. Example "Overnight" 
SupplierDO supplierRef bigint NOT_NULL The supplier the name of the delivery option should be used for. 

[1] Not all references are enforced by a foreign key where they could.
Such "missing" foreign keys are denoted with [[ ]].

[2] Constraints:
PK : the column is part of the primary key
UNIQUE: does don't cover unique constraints and indexes defined on more than one column.

Constraints and Indexes 

Type Name Definition

UNIQUE CONSTRAINT Supplier2DeliveryOptionDefDO_deliveryOptionDefRef_key UNIQUE ("deliveryOptionDefRef", "supplierRef") 
FOREIGN KEY Supplier2DeliveryOptionDefDO_fk_supplierRef FOREIGN KEY ("supplierRef") REFERENCES "SupplierDO"(id) 
FOREIGN KEY deliveryOptionDefRefSupplier2DeliveryOptionDefDO FOREIGN KEY ("deliveryOptionDefRef") REFERENCES "DeliveryOptionDefDO"(id)
